- What feature does this add?

## Type of Change

Please mark the relevant option with an "x":

- [ ] Bug fix (non-breaking change that fixes an issue)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change that adds functionality)
- [ ] Breaking change (fix or feature that would cause existing functionality to change)
- [ ] Documentation update
- [ ] Code refactoring
- [ ] Performance improvement

## Changes Made

Describe the specific changes:

- [ ] Backend changes (Python/FastAPI)
- [ ] Frontend changes (React/Next.js)
- [ ] Database changes (migrations)
- [ ] API changes (endpoints, schemas)
- [ ] Documentation updates

## Testing

Describe the testing you've done:

### Backend Testing
- [ ] Unit tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests added/updated
- [ ] All backend tests passing (`pytest`)
- [ ] Coverage maintained or improved

### Frontend Testing
- [ ] Component tests added/updated
- [ ] Integration tests added/updated
- [ ] All frontend tests passing (`npm run test`)
- [ ] Manual testing completed

### Manual Testing
- [ ] Feature works as expected
- [ ] No regressions in existing functionality
- [ ] Error handling works correctly
- [ ] Edge cases handled

## Code Quality

- [ ] Code follows project style guidelines
- [ ] Backend code formatted with Black and isort
- [ ] Frontend code formatted with Prettier
- [ ] No linting errors (`eslint`, `flake8`, `mypy`)
- [ ] Comments added for complex logic
- [ ] Docstrings/JSDoc added for new functions
- [ ] Type hints present (Python)
- [ ] Type annotations present (TypeScript)

## Documentation

- [ ] README updated (if needed)
- [ ] API documentation updated (if needed)
- [ ] Architecture documentation updated (if needed)
- [ ] Database schema documented (if changed)
- [ ] Commit messages follow Conventional Commits

## Checklist

- [ ] My code follows the code style of this project
- [ ] I have performed a self-review of my own code
- [ ] I have commented my code, particularly in hard-to-understand areas
- [ ] I have made corresponding changes to the documentation
- [ ] My changes generate no new warnings
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works
- [ ] New and existing unit tests passed locally with my changes
- [ ] Any dependent changes have been merged and published in downstream modules
- [ ] I have not decreased the code quality or test coverage
